title: 63rd Division (Imperial Japanese Army)
text:
The was an <a href="infantry">infantry</a> <a href="Division%20%28military%20unit%29">division</a> of the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Army">Imperial Japanese Army</a>. Its <a href="call%20sign">call sign</a> was the . It was formed on 1 May 1943 at <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a>, simultaneously with the <a href="62nd%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">62nd division</a> as a security (type C) division. The nucleus for the formation was the part of the <a href="6th%20Independent%20Mixed%20Brigade%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">6th</a> and <a href="15th%20Independent%20Mixed%20Brigade%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">15th</a> independent mixed brigades. As a security division, it lacked an artillery regiment. The men of the division were drafted from the <a href="Utsunomiya">Utsunomiya</a> mobilization district. The division was initially assigned to the <a href="First%20Army%20%28Japan%29">1st army</a>.
Action.
Upon formation, the "63rd division" was sent to <a href="Baoding">Baoding</a> to perform a garrison duties.
From 19 May 1944, the "63rd division" has also participated in the <a href="Operation%20Ichi-Go">Operation Ichi-Go</a>, attacking <a href="Luoyang">Luoyang</a> together with the 9th independent infantry brigade without much success until being rescued by the rest of the <a href="Twelfth%20Army%20%28Japan%29">12th army</a>.
In June 1945, the "63rd division" was relieved from the front line duty and sent to <a href="Tongliao">Tongliao</a>. It fought in <a href="Soviet%20invasion%20of%20Manchuria">Soviet invasion of Manchuria</a>, ending up in eastern <a href="Mukden">Mukden</a> by the time the fighting ceased 2 September 1945 without any formal treaty.
The division personnel was mostly taken prisoner to the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>, and was confined to labour camps in <a href="Mukden">Mukden</a>, <a href="Irkutsk">Irkutsk</a>, <a href="Russian%20Turkestan">Russian Turkestan</a> and other places. Although prisoners have started to return in November 1945, some soldiers have remained in captivity, with last of them dead in 1954.
